class.name: ShapeCast
class.brief_description: Node for physics collision sweep and immediate overlap queries. Similar to the [RayCast] node.
class.description: Shape casting allows to detect collision objects by sweeping the [member shape] along the cast direction determined by [member target_position] (useful for things like beam weapons). Immediate collision overlaps can be done with the [member target_position] set to [code]Vector3(0, 0, 0)[/code] and by calling [method force_shapecast_update] within the same [b]physics_frame[/b]. This also helps to overcome some limitations of [Area] when used as a continuous detection area, often requiring waiting a couple of frames before collision information is available to [Area] nodes, and when using the signals creates unnecessary complexity. The node can detect multiple collision objects, but it's usually used to detect the first collision. [b]Note:[/b] Shape casting is more computationally expensive compared to ray casting.

method.name: add_exception
method.description: Adds a collision exception so the shape does not report collisions with the specified [CollisionObject] node.

method.name: add_exception_rid
method.description: Adds a collision exception so the shape does not report collisions with the specified [RID].

method.name: clear_exceptions
method.description: Removes all collision exceptions for this [ShapeCast].

method.name: force_shapecast_update
method.description: Updates the collision information for the shape. Use this method to update the collision information immediately instead of waiting for the next [code]_physics_process[/code] call, for example if the shape or its parent has changed state. [b]Note:[/b] [code]enabled[/code] is not required for this to work.

method.name: get_closest_collision_safe_fraction
method.description: The fraction from the [ShapeCast]'s origin to its [member target_position] (between 0 and 1) of how far the shape can move without triggering a collision.

method.name: get_closest_collision_unsafe_fraction
method.description: The fraction from the [ShapeCast]'s origin to its [member target_position] (between 0 and 1) of how far the shape must move to trigger a collision.

method.name: get_collider
method.description: Returns the collided [Object] of one of the multiple collisions at [code]index[/code], or [code]null[/code] if no object is intersecting the shape (i.e. [method is_colliding] returns [code]false[/code]).

method.name: get_collider_rid
method.description: Returns the [RID] of the collided object of one of the multiple collisions at [code]index[/code].

method.name: get_collider_shape
method.description: Returns the shape ID of the colliding shape of one of the multiple collisions at [code]index[/code], or [code]0[/code] if no object is intersecting the shape (i.e. [method is_colliding] returns [code]false[/code]).

method.name: get_collision_count
method.description: The number of collisions detected at the point of impact. Use this to iterate over multiple collisions as provided by [method get_collider], [method get_collider_shape], [method get_collision_point], and [method get_collision_normal] methods.

method.name: get_collision_mask_value
method.description: Returns whether or not the specified layer of the [member collision_mask] is enabled, given a [code]layer_number[/code] between 1 and 32.

method.name: get_collision_normal
method.description: Returns the normal of one of the multiple collisions at [code]index[/code] of the intersecting object.

method.name: get_collision_point
method.description: Returns the collision point of one of the multiple collisions at [code]index[/code] where the shape intersects the colliding object. [b]Note:[/b] this point is in the [b]global[/b] coordinate system.

method.name: is_colliding
method.description: Returns whether any object is intersecting with the shape's vector (considering the vector length).

method.name: remove_exception
method.description: Removes a collision exception so the shape does report collisions with the specified [CollisionObject] node.

method.name: remove_exception_rid
method.description: Removes a collision exception so the shape does report collisions with the specified [RID].

method.name: resource_changed
method.description: This method is used internally to update the debug gizmo in the editor. Any code placed in this function will be called whenever the [member shape] resource is modified.

method.name: set_collision_mask_value
method.description: Based on [code]value[/code], enables or disables the specified layer in the [member collision_mask], given a [code]layer_number[/code] between 1 and 32.

members.member: If [code]true[/code], collision with [Area]s will be reported.
If [code]true[/code], collision with [PhysicsBody]s will be reported.

The shape's collision mask. Only objects in at least one collision layer enabled in the mask will be detected. See [url=$DOCS_URL/tutorials/physics/physics_introduction.html#collision-layers-and-masks]Collision layers and masks[/url] in the documentation for more information.
Returns the complete collision information from the collision sweep. The data returned is the same as in the [method PhysicsDirectSpaceState.get_rest_info] method.

The custom color to use to draw the shape in the editor and at run-time if [b]Visible Collision Shapes[/b] is enabled in the [b]Debug[/b] menu. This color will be highlighted at run-time if the [ShapeCast] is colliding with something. If set to [code]Color(0.0, 0.0, 0.0)[/code] (by default), the color set in [member ProjectSettings.debug/shapes/collision/shape_color] is used.
If [code]true[/code], the parent node will be excluded from collision detection.
The collision margin for the shape. A larger margin helps detecting collisions more consistently, at the cost of precision.
The number of intersections can be limited with this parameter, to reduce the processing time.
The [Shape] to be used for collision queries.
The shape's destination point, relative to this node's [code]position[/code].
